intro: Wulffia quitensis, commonly known as the Peruvian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, hairy fruits that contain several seeds. Wulffia quitensis is often found in high-altitude regions and is adapted to the cool, temperate climate of its native habitat.
